title.text: SOME COMPUTATIONAL PROPERTISS OF TREE ADJOINING

abstractContent.text: Tree Adjoining Grammar (TAG) is u formalism for natural language grammars.
Some of the basic notions of TAG's were introduced in [Jo~hi,Levy, mad Takakashi I~'Sl and by [Jo~hi, l~l.
A detailed investigation of the linguistic relevance of TAG's has been carried out in IKroch and Joshi,1985~.

In this paper, we will describe some new results for TAG's, espe¢ially in the following areas: (I) parsing complexity of TAG's, (2) some closure results for TAG's, and (3) the relationship to Head grammars.

introductionContent.text: lnvestigatiou of constrained grammatical system from the point of view of their linguistic &leqnary and their computational tractability has been a mnjor concern of computational linguists for the last several years.

Generalized Phrase Structure grammars (GPSG), Lexical Functional grunmmm (LFG), Phrm~ Linking grammars (PLG), and Tree Adjoining grammars (TAG) are some key examples of grammatical systems that have been and still continue to be investignted along theme lines.
